tool.name: CreateInflowFileFromWRFHydroRunoff
tool.displayname: Create Inflow File From WRF-Hydro Runoff

param.name: in_WRF_Hydro_runoff_file
param.dialogReference: The input of WRF-Hydro runoff file in NetCDF format.

param.name: in_weight_table
param.dialogReference: The input of the weight table that is previously created with the tool Create Weight Table From WRF Geogrid. The weight table should be based on the WRF geogrid file of the same spatial resolution as the WRF-Hydro runoff file input into this tool.

param.name: out_inflow_file
param.dialogReference: The output of RAPID inflow file in NetCDF format.

tool.summary: Creates RAPID NetCDF input of water inflow based on the Weather Research and Forecasting Model Hydrological (WRF-Hydro) modeling system output and previously created weight table
tool.usage:
• The input WRF-Hydro runoff file must be of Network Command Data Form (NetCDF) format. It must contain variables 'SFCRNOFF'(accumulatedsurface runoff) and 'INTRFLOW' (accumulated interflow runoff) in dimensions of 'Time', 'south_north', and 'west_east'. Its spatial resolution must be consistent with the spatial resolution of the input WRF geogrid file used for creating the weight table.

  • The input weight table must be written as comma-seperated values (csv) in plain-text form. It is the output of the tool Create Weight Table From WRF Geogrid.

  • The output RAPID inflow file has a m3_riv variable with the dimension of HydroID of the input drainage line features. The HydroID values are in ascending order.

idCitation.resTitle: Create Inflow File From WRF-Hydro Runoff

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Creates RAPID NetCDF input of water inflow based on the Weather Research and Forecasting Model Hydrological (WRF-Hydro) modeling system output and previously created weight table
